{{also|lång|lāng|láng|lǎng|làng|lảng|lạng|Lang}} ==English== ===Pronunciation=== * {{enPR|lăng}}, {{IPA|en|/læŋ/}} * {{rhymes|en|æŋ}} ===Etymology 1=== ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # {{form of|en|Abbreviation|language}} ===Etymology 2=== ====Adjective==== {{en-adj|er}} # {{lb|en|obsolete}} [[long]] =====Derived terms===== * {{l|en|lang syne}} ====Further reading==== * {{R:Webster 1913|lang}} ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=agln|Angl.}} ---- ==Alemannic German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gsw|gmh|lanc}}, from {{inh|gsw|goh|lang}}, from {{inh|gsw|gem-pro|*langaz}}. Cognate with {{cog|de|lang}}, {{cog|nl|lang}}, {{cog|en|long}}, {{cog|is|langur}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gsw|/lɑŋ/}} ===Adjective=== {{head|gsw|adjective|comparative|lenger|superlative|lengscht}} # [[long]] # [[tall]], [[high]] ====Declension==== {{gsw-decl-adj|lang}} ---- ==Danish== ===Etymology=== From {{der|da|non|langr}}, from {{der|da|gem-pro|*langaz||long}}, from {{der|da|ine-pro|*dluh₂gʰó-||long}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|da|/lanɡ/|[lɑŋˀ]}} * {{rhymes|da|ɑŋˀ}} ===Adjective=== {{da-adj|langt|lange|længere|længst|længste}} # [[long]] (having great distance) ---- ==Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nl|dum|lanc}}, from {{inh|nl|odt|*lang}}, from {{inh|nl|gem-pro|*langaz}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/lɑŋ/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-lang.ogg|audio}} * {{hyphenation|nl|lang}} * {{rhymes|nl|ɑŋ}} ===Adjective=== {{nl-adj}} # [[long]] #: {{usex|nl|Het was een '''lange''' dag.|It was a '''long''' day.}} #: {{ant|nl|kort}} # [[tall]] #: {{usex|nl|Een '''lange''' man.|A '''tall''' man.}} #: {{ant|nl|kort|klein}} # long (time), [[lengthy]], a long time #: {{usex|nl|Het duurt '''lang'''.|It takes a long time.}} #: {{usex|nl|Wie heeft '''het langst''' gespeeld?|Who played '''longest'''?}} ====Inflection==== {{nl-decl-adj}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|nl|jarenlang}} * {{l|nl|langdurig}} * {{l|nl|langgerekt}} * {{l|nl|onlangs}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|nl|lengte}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|af|lank}} * {{desc|srn|langa|bor=1}} ===Adverb=== {{nl-adv}} # {{lb|nl|with negation}} [[by far]] #: {{usex|nl|'''Lang''' niet iedereen houdt van vlees.|Not everyone '''by far''' likes meat.}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|de|gmh|lanc}}, from {{der|de|goh|lang}}, from {{der|de|gem-pro|*langaz}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/laŋ/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/laŋk/}} {{a|some northern speakers}} * {{audio|de|De-lang.ogg|audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aŋ}} ===Adjective=== {{de-adj|länger|längsten}} # [[long]]; [[lengthy]] {{gloss|in space or time}} # {{lb|de|of a person}} [[tall]] # {{lb|de|with units of time, chiefly {{m|de|Jahre}}}} [[many]] {{gloss|indicating the length of the time in total}} #: {{ux|de|Er hat '''lange''' Jahre damit verbracht, diese Frage zu erörtern.|He spent '''many''' years reasoning about this question.}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-adj|lang|länger|längst}} ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|tall}} {{l|de|groß}} {{q|commoner}} * {{sense|many}} {{l|de|viel}} ====Antonyms==== * {{sense|long in space or time}} {{l|de|kurz}} * {{sense|tall}} {{l|de|klein}}; {{l|de|kurz}} {{q|latter rather rude}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|jahrelang}} * {{l|de|Länge}} * {{l|de|Langeweile}} * {{l|de|langmachen}} * {{l|de|langschwänzig}} * {{l|de|langweilig}} * {{l|de|langwierig}} * {{l|de|monatelang}} * {{l|de|stundenlang}} * {{l|de|überlang}} * {{l|de|verlängern}} * {{l|de|wochenlang}} * {{l|de|Vokuhila}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # {{lb|de|chiefly|colloquial|but also found in formal style}} {{alternative form of|de|lange}} #: ''Der Ausflug hat '''lang''' gedauert.'' #:: The trip took quite '''long'''. # [[long]], [[sprawled]], [[stretched]] {{gloss|physically}} #: ''Er lag '''lang''' auf der Erde.'' #:: He lay sprawled on the ground. ===Postposition=== {{head|de|postposition|+ accusative}} # [[for]] {{gloss|temporal}} #: ''Er ist ein Jahr '''lang''' um die Welt gereist.'' #:: He travelled around the world '''for''' one year. #* '''2010''', ''[[w:Der Spiegel|Der Spiegel]]'', issue [http://www.spiegel.de/spiegel/print/index-2010-34.html 34/2010], page 87: #*: Die Pharmakonzerne müssen ihre Preise nun drei Jahre '''lang''' auf dem Niveau vom Sommer 2009 einfrieren. #*:: The pharmaceutical companies now have to freeze their prices for three years at the level of summer 2009. # {{lb|de|chiefly|colloquial|but also found in formal style}} {{alternative form of|de|entlang}} #: ''Gehen Sie einfach diese Straße '''lang'''!'' #:: Just go '''along''' this street! ===Verb=== {{head|de|verb form}} # {{de-verb form of|langen|i|s}} ---- ==Haitian Creole== ===Etymology=== From {{der|ht|fr|langue||language}}. ===Noun=== {{head|ht|noun}} # [[language]] # [[tongue]] ====Synonyms==== * {{l|ht|langaj}} [[Category:ht:Anatomy]] [[Category:ht:Language]] ---- ==Icelandic== ===Noun=== {{head|is|noun form|g=m}} # {{inflection of|is|langur||acc|indef|s}} # {{inflection of|is|langur||dat|indef|s}} ---- ==Low German== ===Etymology=== From {{der|nds|osx|lang}}, from {{der|nds|gem-pro|*langaz}}.
